author: GamingBolt
description:
Promising the most substantial overhaul for generations, Sports Interactive’s now not-so annual football management sim returns after a year-long hiatus. Football Manager 26’s core focus appears to be streamlining: overhauling UI for quicker decision making, sharpening tactical flow to reflect the modern game, and smoothing recruitment to foster frictionless squad development season-by-season, and more. 

In many ways, FM26 is a suite of overhauled systems to purposely renovate the game’s fundamentals. Supporting these innovations is the series’ switch to Unity Engine, bringing a graphical overhaul which Sports Interactive have used to boost FM26’s authenticity and realism. This video discusses 15 things to know before buying; with streamlining the overarching focus, getting the best out of any squad - from global icons to lower leagues - could be the most enjoyable it’s ever been.
title: Football Manager 26 - 15 Things You Need To Know Before You Buy

author: GamingBolt
description:
The year is slowly but surely coming to a close, and even after the onslaught of major releases in September and October, November has its fair share of games to offer. 

Between that one sequel that everyone either loves or hates (you know the one), there are epic open-world titles to look forward to, the return of a beloved puzzler, an extraction shooter, and even a game that's over nine years in development. Without further ado, check out the 15 biggest games launching in November 2025.
title: 15 NEW Games of November 2025 You Definitely NEED TO CHECK OUT

author: GamingBolt
description:
Bounty Star's overall cozy pace feels at odds with its gameplay loop, where repetitive activities lead to boredom more than relaxation. Even the side bounties begin to repeat, but you can't pursue their optional objectives again for more cash. 

If the combat felt more fluid or the missions offered more variety – heck, even if the story kept up with Clementine's character development rather than serving as an accessory, Bounty Star could have stood out. Instead, it teeters more towards sedative than contemplative on the regular.
title: Bounty Star Review - The Final Verdict
